testprocedure.test-case-summary: This test procedure is called by a test case and is used to verify the SUTs support of the dlLCSStatusRequest dialog as an OC using variables provided by the calling test case. This procedure supports verification of requirements related to user need 2.3.5.8.3 [Need to Share Controllable Lanes Status] and is used for both valid and invalid test cases.

testStep.functionId: Step 1 CONFIGURE: Determine the Application Layer Standard that will be used for this test. RECORD this information as: ApplicationLayerStandard: ${ApplicationLayerStandard}

Step 2 CONFIGURE: Determine the dialog performance requirement for Send LCS Status Information Upon Request (NTRM 3.3.5.9.2.1}. RECORD this value as: TMDD_N72R839_Send_LCS_Status_Information_Upon_Request_Parameter = ${TMDD_N72R839_Send_LCS_Status_Information_Upon_Request_Parameter}

Step 3 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Restrictions - Device Status is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.3.1.2.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N72R394_Restrictions___Device_Status_Supported = ${TMDD_N72R394_Restrictions___Device_Status_Supported}

Step 4 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Unique Identifier of the Controlling Center is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.3.1.2.2). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N72R395_Unique_Identifier_of_the_Controlling_Center_Supported = ${TMDD_N72R395_Unique_Identifier_of_the_Controlling_Center_Supported}

Step 5 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Device Communications Status is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.3.1.2.3). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N72R396_Device_Communications_Status_Supported = ${TMDD_N72R396_Device_Communications_Status_Supported}

Step 6 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Operator Identifier - Device Status is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.3.1.2.4). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N72R397_Operator_Identifier___Device_Status_Supported = ${TMDD_N72R397_Operator_Identifier___Device_Status_Supported}

Step 7 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Event Identifier - Device Status is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.3.1.2.5). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N72R398_Event_Identifier___Device_Status_Supported = ${TMDD_N72R398_Event_Identifier___Device_Status_Supported}

Step 8 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Event Response Plan - Device Status is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.3.1.2.6). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N72R399_Event_Response_Plan___Device_Status_Supported = ${TMDD_N72R399_Event_Response_Plan___Device_Status_Supported}

Step 9 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Device Status Date and Time Change Information is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.3.1.2.7). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N72R400_Device_Status_Date_and_Time_Change_Information_Supported = ${TMDD_N72R400_Device_Status_Date_and_Time_Change_Information_Supported}

Step 10 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Restrictions - Error Report is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.1.4.1.2.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N72R14_Restrictions___Error_Report_Supported = ${TMDD_N72R14_Restrictions___Error_Report_Supported}
Step 11 CONFIGURE: Define the message that will be sent to the SUT. RECORD this information as: RequestMessage: ${RequestMessage}
Step 12 CONFIGURE: Determine whether an error response message is expected for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorResponseExpected: ${ErrorResponseExpected}
Step 13 CONFIGURE: IF ErrorResponseExpected is true, determine the expected error code response for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorTypeExpected: ${ErrorTypeExpected}

Step 14 REQUEST-RESPONSE-EC with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlLCSStatusRequest RESPONSETIMEREQUIRED=TMDD_N72R839_Send_LCS_Status_Information_Upon_Request_Parameter REQUESTMESSAGE = RequestMessage ERRORRESPONSEEXPECTED = ErrorResponseExpected ERRORTYPEEXPECTED = ErrorTypeExpected

Step 15 IF ErrorResponseExpected is not equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps. Note: If a verification step fails, then test execution will proceed at the next subsequent Post Condition step, if present. Otherwise, test execution will proceed to the final Exit step.
Step 15.1 VERIFY that a device-status-header data frame exists within each instance of data frame lCSStatusMsg.lcs-status-item
Step 15.2 VERIFY that an organization-information data frame exists within each instance of data frame lCSStatusMsg.lcs-status-item.device-status-header
Step 15.3 VERIFY that a device-id data element exists within each instance of data frame lCSStatusMsg.lcs-status-item.device-status-header
Step 15.4 VERIFY that a lCSStatusMsg message was received.
Step 15.5 IF TMDD_N72R394_Restrictions___Device_Status_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 15.5.1 VERIFY that a restrictions data frame exists within each instance of data frame lCSStatusMsg.lcs-status-item.device-status-header
Step 15.6 IF TMDD_N72R395_Unique_Identifier_of_the_Controlling_Center_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 15.6.1 VERIFY that a center-id data element exists within each instance of data frame lCSStatusMsg.lcs-status-item.device-status-header
Step 15.7 IF TMDD_N72R396_Device_Communications_Status_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 15.7.1 VERIFY that a device-comm-status data element exists within each instance of data frame lCSStatusMsg.lcs-status-item.device-status-header
Step 15.8 IF TMDD_N72R397_Operator_Identifier___Device_Status_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 15.8.1 VERIFY that an operator-id data element exists within each instance of data frame lCSStatusMsg.lcs-status-item.device-status-header
Step 15.9 IF TMDD_N72R398_Event_Identifier___Device_Status_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 15.9.1 VERIFY that an event-id data element exists within each instance of data frame lCSStatusMsg.lcs-status-item.device-status-header
Step 15.10 IF TMDD_N72R399_Event_Response_Plan___Device_Status_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 15.10.1 VERIFY that a response-plan-id data element exists within each instance of data frame lCSStatusMsg.lcs-status-item.device-status-header
Step 15.11 IF TMDD_N72R400_Device_Status_Date_and_Time_Change_Information_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 15.11.1 VERIFY that a last-comm-time data frame exists within each instance of data frame lCSStatusMsg.lcs-status-item.device-status-header
Step 15.12 VERIFY that the values within the RESPONSE message are correct per the TMDD standard and known operational conditions.

USER-VERIFY-MESSAGE.functionId: The User Verifies the message content

testStep.functionId: Step 16 IF ErrorResponseExpected is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps. If a verification step fails, then test execution will proceed at the next subsequent Post Condition step, if present. Otherwise, test execution will proceed to the final Exit step.
Step 16.1 VERIFY that an errorReportMsg message was received.
Step 16.2 VERIFY that an organization-information data frame exists within message errorReportMsg.
Step 16.3 VERIFY that an organization-requesting data frame exists within message errorReportMsg.
Step 16.4 VERIFY that an error-code data element exists within message errorReportMsg.
Step 16.5 VERIFY that an error-text data element exists within message errorReportMsg.
Step 16.6 VERIFY that data element error-code is set to ErrorResponseTypeExpected.
Step 16.7 IF TMDD_N72R14_Restrictions___Error_Report_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 16.7.1 VERIFY that a restrictions data frame exists within message errorReportMsg.
Step 17 EXIT
